medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient developed right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and then nausea and vomiting the day prior to admission. The pain was reported as moderate in severity. The patient reported chills but no fever and denied diarrhea or lightheadedness. Hypertension noted in the ED at 238/87.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral blindness, peptic ulcer disease status post Bilroth II, hypertriglyceridemia.
medical_history.family_history: No known colorectal cancer or other GI malignancy.
